00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 #include "ht32_board_config.h"
00032 
00033 /** @addtogroup HT32_Series_Peripheral_Examples HT32 Peripheral Examples
00034   * @{

00036

00042   * @{
00043   */
00044 
00045 
00046 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00047 void delay(vu32 counter) { while (counter--); }
00048 
00049 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00050 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00051   * @brief  Main program.
00052   * @retval None
00053   * @note At this stage the microcontroller clock setting is already configured,
00054   *       this is done through SystemInit() function which is called from startup
00055   *       file (startup_ht32fxxxx.s) before branching to application main.
00056   *       To reconfigure the default setting of SystemInit() function, refer to
00057   *       system_ht32fxxxx.c file
00058   * @details Main program as following:
00059   *   - Init LED1, LED2 used to output state.
00060   *   - Enable RTC PCLK.
00061   *   - Wait till the backup domain could be accessed.
00062   *   - Enable NVIC LVD interrupt.
00063   *   - Enable BOD reset. For the BOD voltage, please refer to the datasheet.
00064   *   - Enable LVD and LVD interrupt. The LVD level is configured around 3.0V.
00065   *     The interrupt service routine will toggle LED2 till the VDD33 above 3.0V.
00066   *   - Toggle LED1 in an infinite loop.
00067   *
00068   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00069 int main(void)
00070 {
00071   /* Enable RTC clock                                                                                       */
00072   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00073   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP        = 1;
00074   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00075 
00076   /* Wait for De-isolation, then backup domain could be accessed                                            */
00077   #if !defined(LIBCFG_NO_PWRCU_TEST_REG)
00078   if (PWRCU_CheckReadyAccessed() != PWRCU_OK)
00079   {
00080     while (1);
00081   }
00082   #endif
00083   /* Init LED1, LED2 used to output state                                                                   */
00084   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00085   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED2);
00086   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED3);
00087 
00088   /* Enable NVIC LVD interrupt                                                                              */
00089   NVIC_EnableIRQ(LVD_BOD_IRQn);
00090 
00091   /* Enable BOD reset. For the BOD voltage, please refer to the datasheet.                                  */
00092   PWRCU_BODRISConfig(PWRCU_BODRIS_RESET);
00093   PWRCU_BODCmd(ENABLE);
00094 
00095   /* Enable LVD. The LVD level is configured around 3.0V.
00096      The interrupt service routine will toggle LED2 till the VDD33 above 3.0V */
00097   PWRCU_SetLVDS(HTCFG_PWRCU_LVDS);
00098   PWRCU_LVDIntWakeupConfig(ENABLE);
00099   PWRCU_LVDCmd(ENABLE);
00100 
00101   /* Toggle LED1 in an infinite loop                                                                        */
00102   while (1)
00103   {
00104     HT32F_DVB_LEDToggle(HT_LED1);
00105     delay(1000000);
00106   }
00107 }
00108 
00109 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00110 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00111   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00112   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00113   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00114   * @retval None
00115   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00116 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00117 {
00118   /*
00119      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00120      Debug message can be added here.
00121      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00122   */
00123 
00124   while (1)
00125   {
00126   }
00127 }
00128 #endif
